overview:
## Discussion

Setting a nonzero value for this property randomizes the effect of the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNParticleSystem/birthRate] property. For each emission period, SceneKit randomly adjusts the birth rate by up to half the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNParticleSystem/birthRateVariation] value. For example, if the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNParticleSystem/birthRate] value is `100` particles and the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNParticleSystem/birthRateVariation] value is `50` particles, the system randomly emits between 75 and 125 particles during its [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNParticleSystem/emissionDuration] period.

The default value is `0.0` seconds, specifying no randomization.

You can animate changes to this property’s value. See [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/animating-scenekit-content].

# birthRateVariation

**Instance Property**

The range of randomized particle birth rate values. Animatable.

## Declaration

```swift
var birthRateVariation: CGFloat { get set }
```

## Discussion

Setting a nonzero value for this property randomizes the effect of the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNParticleSystem/birthRate] property. For each emission period, SceneKit randomly adjusts the birth rate by up to half the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNParticleSystem/birthRateVariation] value. For example, if the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNParticleSystem/birthRate] value is `100` particles and the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNParticleSystem/birthRateVariation] value is `50` particles, the system randomly emits between 75 and 125 particles during its [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNParticleSystem/emissionDuration] period.

The default value is `0.0` seconds, specifying no randomization.

You can animate changes to this property’s value. See [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/animating-scenekit-content].

## Managing Particle Emission Timing

- **emissionDuration**: The duration, in seconds, over which the system spawns new particles. Animatable.
- **emissionDurationVariation**: The range, in seconds, of randomized emission duration values. Animatable.
- **idleDuration**: The duration, in seconds, of periods when the system emits no particles. Animatable.
- **idleDurationVariation**: The range, in seconds, of randomized idle duration values. Animatable.
- **loops**: A Boolean value that determines whether the system repeats its emission and idle periods.
- **warmupDuration**: The duration, in seconds, for which particles are spawned before the system is first rendered. Animatable.
- **birthRate**: The number of particles spawned during each emission period. Animatable.
